msContents.summary: Magic formula on behalf of a little girl who is ill

msItem.note: Source of description: Recto; Verso with traces of the ink on the recto
Some kind of lines and sketches above and belowe the text

provenance.p: Purchased in Berlin by Lund University Library in 1933, from prof. Carl Schmidt; Isabella Andorlini "Scavi e acquisti di papiri negli anni '30: il caso dei PLund" in Comunicazioni, Firenze 1995, Istituto papirologico G. Vitelli, p. 45-50

div.ab: I, Abrasax, shall deliver. Abrasax am I! ABRASAX ABRASICHOOU, help little Sophia-Priskilla. Get hold of and do away with what comes to little Sophia-Priskilla, whether it is a shivering fit - get hold of it! Whether a phantom - get hold of it! Whether a daimon - get hold of it! I, Abrasax, shall deliver. Abrasax am I! ABRASAX ABRASICHOOU. Get hold, get hold of and do away with ... what comes to little Sophia-Priskilla on this very day, whether it is a shivering fit - do away with it! Wheather a daimon - do away with it!

listBibl.bibl: P. Lund. IV 12 H. D. Betz, The Greek magical papyri in translation, Chicago & London 1986, PGM 89 Supplementum magicum, Vol. I, ed. R. W. Daniel & F. Maltomini, K˜ln 1990 (Papyrologica Coloniensia Vol. XVI.1) p. 35-38 BL IX 155; TM 69043; M P 6041; LDAB 10334; K. Preisendanz, Zur öberlieferung der griechischen Zauberpapyri, Miscellanea critica, Teil I, Leipzig 1964, p. 211-212 (no 88)
